page.title: ccunsc
page.t: The Artemis-class was designed in the mid-stage of the Human-Covenant War, with a single purpose: to completely destroy all Covenant vessels they encounter. Named after the ancient Greek goddess of the hunt, it is often deployed to patrol disputed space regions, using its incredibly advanced sensors to detect and destroy any enemy ships. Such missions are often jokingly referred to as "Hunting Expeditions" by the warriors.
Capable of launching various artillery shells, cargo packages, and suicide vehicles with dedicated payloads.
It is a large automatic cannon used post-war, capable of firing various special shells, including the latest experimental shield-piercing rounds.

A heavy shipborne autocannon equipped on New Era-class Heavy Aircraft Carriers and Late Autumn-class Heavy Cruisers; it is also fitted on the UNSC Pillar of Autumn, which was modified for Operation Red Flag.

A heavy shipborne autocannon equipped on New Era-class Heavy Aircraft Carriers and Late Autumn-class Heavy Cruisers; it is also fitted on the UNSC Pillar of Autumn, which was modified for Operation Red Flag.
